title: Sri Lanka Deploys Soldiers At Petrol Pumps As Country Faces Worst Financial Crisis
snippet: Four people have died in queues for fuel. Three senior citizens died of exhaustion while waiting in long queues for over six hours in heat and one died from stabbing in a scuffle..

title: Ukraine Live Updates: Russia Cracks Down on Dissent as Invasion Stalls
snippet: Russia sentenced Aleksei A. Navalny to nine years in prison and added to its draconian censorship law. Ukrainians continued to mount a spirited defense, saying they had recaptured the town of Makariv.

title: Indian tycoon Gautam Adani's wind project in crisis-hit Sri Lanka raises eyebrows
snippet: BANGALORE - New energy investments in Sri Lanka by one of India's richest tycoons might bring some much-needed foreign exchange for the economic crisis-hit island, but they have sparked allegations of favouritism and diplomatic blackmail to dilute China's influence in the country.

title: Bilateral aviation services deal signed between Sri Lanka and the Netherlands
snippet: Sri Lanka and the Netherlands plan to sign a bilateral aviation services agreement with the aim to launch direct passenger and cargo flights between the two countries. Although approval of the Cabinet of Ministers has been granted to sign a bilateral ...

title: Sri Lanka schedules power cuts of up to 5 hours on March 23
snippet: Power cuts of 5 hours for some areas in Sri Lanka and 2 hours and 40 minutes for other areas were approved in two blocks for March 23 Wednesday, Public Utilities Commission Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said as a forex crisis creates power shortages in the dry season.

title: China turns its back on Sri Lanka economic crisis
snippet: China refused to assist Sri Lanka which appealed to reschedule its huge Chinese debt burden in the face of the Covid-19 outbreak that has adversely affected the tourism sector, said a media report. Colombo appealed if a restructuring of the debt could be arranged to mitigate the economic crisis

title: U.S. willing to help Sri Lanka find sustainable solutions to urgent economic challenges
snippet: Sanath Nanayakkare Julie Chung, the U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka met with UNP Leader and former prime minister Ranil Wickremasinghe (RW) on Monday, March 21 at the latter's private residence in Colombo.

title: Sri Lanka import licenses will worsen economic crisis, promote corruption: think tank
snippet: Sri Lanka's new import licensing wave will worsen an economic crisis, promote corruption and will not solve the foreign exchange problems, Advocata Institute, a Colombo based think tank has said.

title: How Four Powerful Brothers Broke an Island Nation
snippet: In just over two years, Sri Lanka's first family has presided over a series of crises mostly of its own making. The island nation of 22 million people is facing its worst economic upheaval in a decade. From an ill-fated fertilizer ban that led to a ...
